file.content:
from dataclasses import dataclass
from datetime import date
from fastlite import database

@dataclass
class Card:
    id: int
    front: str
    back: str
    next_review: date
    interval: int

db = database("cards.db")
cards = db.create(Card, pk="id")

content.text: I have a clear picture. I'll implement the CRUD routes in main.py and tests in test_app.py.

input.old_string:
from dataclasses import dataclass
from datetime import date
from fastlite import database

@dataclass
class Card:
    id: int
    front: str
    back: str
    next_review: date
    interval: int

db = database("cards.db")
cards = db.create(Card, pk="id")

input.content:
import pytest
from starlette.testclient import TestClient
from datetime import date
from main import app, cards, Card

@pytest.fixture
def client():
    # Clear cards before each test
    for c in list(cards()):
        cards.delete(c.id)
    return TestClient(app)

def test_root_redirects_to_cards(client):
    response = client.get("/", follow_redirects=False)
    assert response.status_code == 303
    assert response.headers["location"] == "/cards"

def test_cards_list_empty(client):
    response = client.get("/cards")
    assert response.status_code == 200
    assert "No cards yet" in response.text

def test_cards_new_form(client):
    response = client.get("/cards/new")
    assert response.status_code == 200
    assert "front" in response.text
    assert "back" in response.text

def test_card_creation(client):
    response = client.post("/cards/new", data={"front": "Hello", "back": "World"}, follow_redirects=False)
    assert response.status_code == 303
    assert response.headers["location"] == "/cards"

    # Verify card was created
    card_list = list(cards())
    assert len(card_list) == 1
    assert card_list[0].front == "Hello"
    assert card_list[0].back == "World"

def test_card_listing(client):
    cards.insert(Card(id=None, front="Q1", back="A1", next_review=date.today(), interval=1))
    response = client.get("/cards")
    assert response.status_code == 200
    assert "Q1" in response.text
    assert "A1" in response.text

def test_card_deletion(client):
    card = cards.insert(Card(id=None, front="Delete Me", back="Please", next_review=date.today(), interval=1))
    response = client.post(f"/cards/{card.id}/delete", follow_redirects=False)
    assert response.status_code == 303
    assert response.headers["location"] == "/cards"

    # Verify card was deleted
    card_list = list(cards())
    assert len(card_list) == 0

     6→@dataclass

     8→    id: int
     9→    front: str
    10→    back: str
    11→    next_review: date
    12→    interval: int

    17→app, rt = fast_app()
    18→
    19→@rt("/")
    20→def get():
    21→    return RedirectResponse("/cards", status_code=303)
    22→
    23→@rt("/cards")
    24→def get():
    25→    card_list = list(cards())
    26→    items = [Li(f"{c.front} / {c.back}", " ",
    27→                Form(Button("Delete"), action=f"/cards/{c.id}/delete", method="post"))
    28→             for c in card_list]
    29→    return Titled("Cards",
    30→                  A("New Card", href="/cards/new"),
    31→                  Ul(*items) if items else "No cards yet")
    32→
    33→@rt("/cards/new")
    34→def get():
    35→    return Titled("New Card",
    36→                  Form(Input(name="front", placeholder="Front"),
    37→                       Input(name="back", placeholder="Back"),
    38→                       Button("Create"),
    39→                       action="/cards/new", method="post"))
    40→
    41→@rt("/cards/new")
    42→def post(front: str, back: str):
    43→    cards.insert(Card(id=None, front=front, back=back, next_review=date.today(), interval=1))
    44→    return RedirectResponse("/cards", status_code=303)
    45→
    46→@rt("/cards/{id}/delete")
    47→def post(id: int):
    48→    cards.delete(id)
    49→    return RedirectResponse("/cards", status_code=303)
    50→

import pytest
from starlette.testclient import TestClient
from datetime import date
from main import app, cards, Card

@pytest.fixture
def client():
    # Clear cards before each test
    for c in list(cards()):
        cards.delete(c.id)
    return TestClient(app)

def test_root_redirects_to_cards(client):
    response = client.get("/", follow_redirects=False)
    assert response.status_code == 303
    assert response.headers["location"] == "/cards"

def test_cards_list_empty(client):
    response = client.get("/cards")
    assert response.status_code == 200
    assert "No cards yet" in response.text

def test_cards_new_form(client):
    response = client.get("/cards/new")
    assert response.status_code == 200
    assert "front" in response.text
    assert "back" in response.text

def test_card_creation(client):
    response = client.post("/cards/new", data={"front": "Hello", "back": "World"}, follow_redirects=False)
    assert response.status_code == 303
    assert response.headers["location"] == "/cards"

    # Verify card was created
    card_list = list(cards())
    assert len(card_list) == 1
    assert card_list[0].front == "Hello"
    assert card_list[0].back == "World"

def test_card_listing(client):
    cards.insert(Card(id=None, front="Q1", back="A1", next_review=date.today(), interval=1))
    response = client.get("/cards")
    assert response.status_code == 200
    assert "Q1" in response.text
    assert "A1" in response.text

def test_card_deletion(client):
    card = cards.insert(Card(id=None, front="Delete Me", back="Please", next_review=date.today(), interval=1))
    response = client.post(f"/cards/{card.id}/delete", follow_redirects=False)
    assert response.status_code == 303
    assert response.headers["location"] == "/cards"

    # Verify card was deleted
    card_list = list(cards())
    assert len(card_list) == 0
